result.execSummary:
The defendant was charged with both OWI (5th or 6th) [Modifiers: Alcohol Fine Enhancer] and Operating w/ PAC (5th or 6th) [Modifiers: Alcohol Fine Enhancer]. The defendant was found guilty of OWI (5th or 6th) [Modifiers: Alcohol Fine Enhancer] and the other charge, Operating w/ PAC (5th or 6th) [Modifiers: Alcohol Fine Enhancer] was dismissed by the court.

  • George A. Bomkamp was found guilty of OWI (5th or 6th) [Modifiers: Alcohol Fine Enhancer], a class H felony, Wisconsin Statutes 346.63(1)(a).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

supervisions.notes: shall be installed on any motor vehicle owned and/or operated by defendant.
Defendant shall undergo an AODA Assessment and follow through with any recommendations resulting therefrom.

miscConds.notes: Defendant to pay fine, costs, blood draw and DNA surcharge within 60 days (4/18/16) through the Dodge County Clerk of Courts office or set up a payment plan within said time.
Defendant shall submit a DNA sample and pay surcharge.

Defendant shall not consume alcohol or other intoxicants.  Defendant must maintain absolute sobriety and shall not go upon the premises of any establishment whose primary business activity involves the sale or distribution of alcoholic beverages, including bars, taverns, liquor stores and beer tents.

Defendant shall not operate a motor vehicle unless he has a valid Wisconsin driver's license.

Defendant shall undergo an AODA Assessment and follow through with any recommendations resulting therefrom.  Defendant shall successfully attend an OWI Victim Impact Panel within 120 days of conviction.

timeConds.notes:
in Dodge County Jail with Huber and Transfer to commence on or before 3/16/16.
Consecutive to: any other sentence previously imposed

records.addlTxt:
(11:30) 15CF285 & 15TR6754: Defendant George A Bomkamp in court with attorney Stephen Eric Mays. Gilbert Thompson appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Court reviews GPQPA & WOR; Court reviews charge/penalties; Court reviews recomm.; Def. pleads Guilty to OWI5th; stip. to facts; Court finds plea made FVK&I and finds Def. guilty of OWI5th w/BAC dismissed and Refusal in 15TR6754 is dismissed; State heard; Atty. Mays heard; Def. heard; Court imposes sentence; Def. informed of rules of IID

**W/H - 3 years PO
- 180 days in DCJ w/H&TR. to comm. 3/16/16
- $2,400 F+C = $3,801 w/in 60 days thru Clerk of Courts
- $250 DNA surcharge and sample
- $26 blood draw (BDCH)
- AODA & VIP w/in 120  days
- absolute sobriety, no bars
- not drive w/o valid license
* 36 mo. Rev. & IID

records.descr: Order for intox driver assessment and safety plan

records.addlTxt: Defendant George A. Bomkamp in court with attorney Stephen Eric Mays by John Orth.  Gilbert Grant Thompson appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Atty Thompson heard, if P/S is not scheduled today, State will request refusal hearing. Future hearing will be scheduled during that status conference. Status conference scheduled for December 17, 2015 at 08:00 am.

Defendant shall not consume alcohol or other intoxicants.  Defendant must maintain absolute sobriety.  and shall not go upon the premises of any establishment whose primary business activity involves the sale or distribution of alcoholic beverages, including bars, taverns, liquor stores and beer tents.  Defendant shall not be in a motor vehicle operated by anyone under the influence of any intoxicant.  Defendant shall not operate a motor vehicle without permission from this Court. Shall not leave the State of Wisconsin.

10:31 - Defendant George A. Bomkamp in court with attorney Stephen Eric Mays.  James T. Sempf appeared for the State of Wisconsin.   Defendant has received copy of Criminal Complaint and advised of rights, charges, penalties and right to Preliminary Hearing. Court finds probable cause. Prelim requested, waiving time limits. Prelim set. Court sets $30,000 PA bond with conditions:   Defendant shall have his/her fingerprints and photographs taken at the Dodge County Sheriff's Department, Jail Division.   Defendant shall not consume alcohol or other intoxicants.  Defendant must maintain absolute sobriety and shall not go upon the premises of any establishment whose primary business activity involves the sale or distribution of alcoholic beverages, including bars, taverns, liquor stores and beer tents.  Defendant shall not operate a motor vehicle without permission from this Court. Defendant shall not leave the State of Wisconsin.  Preliminary hearing scheduled for October 22, 2015 at 01:30 pm.
